Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Virile \Vi"rile\ (?; 277), a. [L. virilis, fr. vir a man; akin to AS. wer: cf. F. viril. See {Werewolf}, {World}, and cf. {Decemvir}, {Virago}, {Virtue}.] Having the nature, properties, or qualities, of an adult man; characteristic of developed manhood; hence, masterful; forceful; specifically, capable of begetting; -- opposed to womanly, feminine, and puerile; as, virile age, virile power, virile organs. [1913 Webster]

virile adj 1: characterized by energy and vigor; "a virile and ever stronger free society"; "a new and virile leadership" 2: characteristic of a man; "a deep male voice"; "manly sports" [syn: {male}, {manful}, {manlike}, {manly}] 3: (of a male) able to copulate [syn: {potent}] [ant: {impotent}]
